title: Some new IMF music
content:
Well, after fiddling around and *almost* succeeding in converting the Vinyl Goddess From Mars music into CMF (the instruments are still a bit off) I ended up with some leftovers.

Here are some [url=http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/newimfs.zip]CMF songs that have been converted into IMF[/url] (21kB), in case anyone out there is looking for some new music for their mod. There are a few from Jill of the Jungle, and one each from Kiloblaster, TD2192 and Xargon. Just bear in mind that AdPlug doesn't play them all properly, so download [url=http://adplug.sf.net]AdPlay[/url] and play them from within DOSBox if you want to hear them the way they're supposed to sound (jill-funky.imf, the Jill of the Jungle level music, is a prime example of this.)

Enjoy![url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content: Well, getting back on topic for a moment I thought DRO2IMF, the program I wrote to create those IMF files from DOSBox .dro captures, might come in handy for someone else, so I tidied it up and [url=http://www.shikadi.net/utils/]stuck it online[/url].  It's source only, so sorry non-Linux people!  (If anyone wants to compile it for DOS and e-mail me the .exe, I'll stick that on the page too.)<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
I don't know about the -s switch.

For example, when I built the precompiled binaries for Lmodkeen2, I did:

make
Linux binary: strip ./lmodkeen
Windows binary: ~/cross-tools/bin/strip.exe ./lmodkeen.exe
------------------------------

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content: Yes, if you're using GCC the "strip" command strips all the debugging info from the .exe, producing a significantly smaller file.  It usually makes more of a difference than all the compiler's optimisation flags.<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
Somehow. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

[pre] #!/bin/sh# by Shadow Master# requires: UPX in its win32 exe, unless somebody knows of a Linux version# Mingw32 cross-compiler with GNU C++ compiler and stuff# FIXME: might need to edit this manually to replace the cross-compiler root!!if [ x$1 = x ]; then&nbsp &nbsp &nbsp &nbsp CROSS_TOOLS_ROOT="$HOME/cross-tools"else&nbsp &nbsp &nbsp &nbsp CROSS_TOOLS_ROOT="$1"fiecho "I'm using $CROSS_TOOLS_ROOT as the cross-compiler root."echo "Fix this script if in doubt (or in case error messages appear <!--EZCODE EMOTICON START --><img src=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif ALT=":D"><!--EZCODE EMOTICON END--> )."echo "Running GNU C++ Compiler... (dro2imf.cpp ---- dro2imf-inf.exe)"# Let me produce a stripped down version <!--EZCODE EMOTICON START --><img src=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif ALT=":)"><!--EZCODE EMOTICON END--> $CROSS_TOOLS_ROOT/bin/i386-mingw32msvc-g++ -g dro2imf.cpp -o dro2imf-inf.exe -Os -s# Sure, you must have this in path or something <!--EZCODE EMOTICON START --><img src=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif ALT=";)"><!--EZCODE EMOTICON END--> # I recommend to configure the kernel with the binfmt_misc module, btw. <!--EZCODE EMOTICON START --><img src=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif ALT=":D"><!--EZCODE EMOTICON END--> echo "Packing executable... (dro2imf-inf.exe ---- dro2imf.exe)"./upx.exe -o dro2imf.exe dro2imf-inf.exe# Ready for action?echo "Done! dro2imf.exe is ready!"[/pre]------------------------------

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
Wouldn't the file come out smaller if you stripped it before compressing it?

And there are versions of UPX for other platforms (including Linux) on its homepage: [url=http://upx.sourceforge.net]upx.sourceforge.net[/url][url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
g++ -s produces binaries that can't be stripped more (strip -s on them does nothing). From the g++ man page:

[quote]Quote:[hr]-s Remove all symbol table and relocation information from the executable.[hr][/quote]

Interesting, isn't it? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content: Oh, that's interesting - but does "g++ -s" produce a different result to "g++ ; strip"?<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
Lemme see...
gcc ; strip
[pre] [igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ gcc test.c -o test[igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ dir -l ./test-rwxr-xr-x 1 igriquel alumnos 4796 jun 25 09:29 ./test[igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ strip ./test[igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ dir -l ./test-rwxr-xr-x 1 igriquel alumnos 2976 jun 25 09:29 ./test[/pre]

Now, gcc -s
[pre] [igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ gcc -s ./test.c -o test[igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ dir -l ./test-rwxr-xr-x 1 igriquel alumnos 2976 jun 25 09:30 ./test[igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ strip ./test[igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ dir -l ./test-rwxr-xr-x 1 igriquel alumnos 2976 jun 25 09:30 ./test[igriquel@nodo26 igriquel]$ [/pre]

Definitively not. (OK, if it was C++ code it should work the same)------------------------------

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content: whay can't someone write a RAW2MID or RAW2IMF, beacuse winamp a.k.a Adplug , can dump many many formats into RAW

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content: I already did - search for dro2midi or dro2imf.  You could either tweak them to read in .raw files, or use Adplay to play the file and capture it in DOSBox to get a .dro file instead of a .raw file.<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
yay! well, but sometimes i get issues when capturing raw in dosbox to dro. tempo issues. and sometimes other problems

only if adplug had a DRO disk writer...

a raw2dro or something , .. :P

i just asking beacuse some tunes is hard to convert, like a TIM tune i tryed, and it didnt work

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
A raw2dro should be possible, but the .raw format can change the tempo during playback, whereas .dro has a fixed playback speed. It should be possible to adjust for this and put more or less delays into the output .dro file, but it could get complicated.

Do you still have problems if you load Adplay under DOSBox and play the .raw file, while capturing it to .dro? Bear in mind that I discovered a bug in the Adplug .dro player while I was doing all this stuff, and the fix for that is only in CVS at the moment so if your copy of Adplug is more than a month old you won't have the fix if you try to play the freshly captured .dro files. This is unlikely to affect the tempo though, mainly the sound of the instruments.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Some new IMF music
content:
ah. i'm sorry, i should told you.
I use Adplug for winamp, to translate from any format to raw.
But i use Adplay in DosBox to translate to *.dro

Also an another bug for capturing in dosbox, is that the start of the song, isn't start, maybe not before half of the file is played, so i get only 40 or 50% of the song
